comment: Great professor. Class consists of her going through long chapter powerpoints and working out practice problems, but I learned a lot from this class. There are 6 tests that felt like came one after the other, but she drops 1 and the tests weren't too bad and has an optional final to drop another. Overall great teacher, would definitely recommend.

Great Class, can not say enough good things about this professor. There was one major group project worth 30% of your grade, and 4 exams (final optional). Awesome class, awesome person. If you do the work and study, you will have no problem getting an A or B

She is very knowledgeable and speaks very eloquently. Not a hard class if you study the power points and especially the exercises for each chapter, before the tests. 4 tests make up 70% of your grade. There is an optional final that replaces your lowest grade. There is a group project, that is 30% of your grade, but it's really not that bad.

Pay attention to the powerpoint and you'll do fine. Pay attention to what's in red and do the practice problems!!! She is very caring and will help you with anything you get stuck on, but she does a very good job at teaching it.

Best Professor! I wish she taught all upper level classes. Extremely organized, articulates lectures superbly, approachable, caring, real life experience, clear in expectations and grading, ppt narrative lectures on D2L w/exercise examples to help with material, speedy responses. Three tests, opt final, group project w/chnce for xtra credit. Loved!

If ur serious about ur investment in education, I highly recommend Prof. Robertson. Knowledgeable in subject material & has real-world xp. If forced to complain, I would say she speaks too fast. Pick her brain while u have a chance. U can learn a lot from her. Drop Fin. Mjr. if u don't enjoy it. Fig. it quick if you know yet. Real 'suck' potential.

Professor Robertson is amazing. She teaches everything you need to know through the powerpoints (so no book needed) and she does an awesome job at walking you through each step to make sure you understand. Attending each class is important in my opinion. She also will answer any questions you have, just make sure you ask!! Best professor!

6 tests, takes the highest 5. and then optional final. Gives you the formulas on the test, very nice and personable lady. just hate the fact it was a night class. but would take again. Finished with a strong A.

She provides a good amount of resources but even after hours of studying I still couldn't get an A on any of her exams. There always seems to be a surprise question or two that trips you up, and more often than not they are weighted more. The material isn't hard,  and if you do the Homework you should be able to get a B, an A not so sure.

She switched up her exams big time this semester, they're multiple choice and pretty difficult. She'll have the hardest questions worth double points so if you miss it it hurts you more. Overall she is a nice professor but this class is a bit annoying, my only B in all finance courses I have taken. Try to avoid, if not then know the HW and PPTs.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--GRADED BY FEW THINGS--GROUP PROJECTS

comment: I took the Hybrid of FIN 4260 and FIN 4620. They can seem daunting if you only show up and nothing else, but she gives you a very clear guide on everything you need to pass. All of her lectures are online and narrated so if you miss a class it isnt the end of the world. If you follow her guides and make a 4000 level effort  youll get an A.
rating_tags: ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--Clear grading criteria--Amazing lectures

comment: Very nice lady but her exams are hard. I'm not having a good experience in this course. She's not the problem, the test structure is the problem. I horribly bad on the Exams.

The grade in her class is based off of a total of 6 tests. The lowest grade out of the first 5 tests will be dropped. In addition, there is an optional final that will replace the second lowest test grade. You do NOT need the book or to come to class to get an A. Just study the power points and the practice questions which are all on d2l.
Very good professor. Explains things exceptionally well. Tests are not too bad. Lets you drop one of your tests. Don't bother getting the book. Her powerpoints are enough.

Patty makes finance easy to understand and relate to. She's always happy to help with questions and is by far one of the friendliest professors I've had to date. There are a good number of tests but the lowest grade is dropped. Just study the ppt slides and HW. I'm a finance major so I'll very likely be taking her again for other classes as well.
I was so scared to take Finance and I can say Patty made it easy for me. Go over the powerpoints, work on the practice questions that she provides, and you will be just fine!

She puts narrated slides online with all the content, which are basically the exact same as her class lectures. She goes over the tests the class period before so you know what to study plus she gives partial credit for anything. Two group assignments, and one individual. This class is easy, you're dumb if you don't take her. Plus, Patty's a dime!

Took the hybrid class.  I could never make it to class (also, never used the book) and still got an A because her online narrated slides and narrated exercise solutions are so good.  I learned a lot.  It takes work, but she gives you all the resources you need.

I took this class as a hybrid. Overall I feel that this was one of the better classes I had in the FIN program. Slides are narrirated online so attendance really is not manditory. Heavily test focused class. An A is easily attainable relative to many other options in the program, but at the same time you still learn a lot. I would recommend 100%.

I took her hybrid Banking class. Nearly all of her lectures are narrated online so one could not even come to class and still pass. All test material comes from the power points so there are no surprises. Everything is explained with clarity so if you have trouble understanding the material banking isn't for you. Definitely recommended.

Take her if its a hybrid course. She posts extremely detailed narrated slides that are your only necessary resource for the tests. Never had to go to class, she simply restates a limited lecture of what is already in the slides. Worth taking her.

She is great. She is so organzied and helpful and very clear on what she expects. You don't need the book at all which is always a plus. Everything you need is in the powerpoints and homework. The test math problems are exactly like the homework. Study the powerpoints and do the homework and you'll do great on the tests. TAKE HER!

Extremely organized and articulate professor. She uses her own PowerPoint slides to explain everything you need to know, step by step.  Her exams are similar to the examples worked in class.  She is extremely helpful and really wants her students to succeed.  I would definitely take her again.
I wouldnt recommend her. She doesn't explain anything. Extremely boring. Had to work really hard to get an A. I would never take her again.

Also took Prof. R for 4620.  Both are hybrids.  She is organized, efficient, and helpful.  Class attendance isn't mandatory, but helps to pass the class.  You don't need the book for either class.  Read her slides, complete the homework and cases, and you'll pass just fine.  Excellent professor.

I took the hybrid of this class so we only met one day a week. $ exams each worth 12.5% of total grade (no cumalative final). Two case studies worth 12.5% each. Also homework that is graded on completion and not accuracy accounts for the last 25%. She is easy to understand and provides all the note you need.
Excellent teacher. Extremely efficient class. Textbook not necessary, but recommend reading chapters before tests. Attendance not mandatory but worth it.

I love her! She's so nice and really sarcastic to people who are annoying in class. She's really helpful and post powerpoints for every chapter covered. Go to class to get the study questions and the answers and read the powerpoints, you'll do fine! She drops the lowest of the first 5 exams, and the last exam only covers one chapter. No homework!

My least interesting class of the semester but my favorite on Test days. There are 5 tests (drop lowest) in the class excluding the final. There are slides for each chapter with roughly 60 pages on each that details everything you need to know about the test. Having the book is not necessary but it can help if you need extra questions for studying

Professor Patty is a wonderful teacher, she cares and helps you a lot if you need help just let her know, many quizzes, but you know what to expect and you have  review sheet. You actually learn, I am taking her again for 2 more Classes.

Great teacher. Very nice and wants all her students to do well. Makes sure everyone learns it. Gives lots of little quizzes but you know exactly what is going to be on them and they require very little studying. Other than that 2 group homework assignments and no tests. Gives extra credit opportunities. Nobody should make below an A in her class.
I love this professor! She is my favorite teacher at Kennesaw. She makes learning fun and easy. I would definitely recommend her to anyone!

She is the best professor to take for this class if you are not interested in Finance, and even so if you are. She makes a tough subject easy, sometimes too easy. She is kinda old though, don't quite understand the hot tamale rating...
Robertson is THE best teacher I have ever had at KSU. She really makes the material easy to understand. So far, we've had four tests and I got As on all of them. DEFINITELY TAKE HER

She explains the material really well. This is the class to take to learn the principals of Finance. There are plenty of sample problems, but is usually takes just one to get the material. It isn't hard stuff...
Extremely easy! Got A. You can drop the lowest. Don't need textbook.

SO so easy!! If you're a finance major, I would recommend taking someone else for Fin 3100 because once you get to more advanced, you may have a difficult time. Tells you exactly what will be on tests, formula sheets. Never opened my book. Got 3 100's out of 6 tests (1 dropped). So easy, if you need an A with no effort.

I used to be some dumb smuck, but after attending Professor Robison's class I now have the where will all to do better in life. But for real she was probably one of the best teachers at Kennesaw. Must Take!!!!
TAKE HER!! Best teacher at KSU. This subject matter is SO difficult, but she somehow makes it understandable. Can't say enough good things about her.
This lady is the best!!!! She tests you on only one or two chapters at a time. Extremely helpful. I would have never gotten an A if I took a different teacher.Take her!!

Excellent professor! Understands this class is not all finance majors. Didnt need to get the book but it helped a few times with studying. She puts all her ppt's online and gives awesome study guides! Take her for 3100!
Great teacher. Makes it easy to understand. Attendence not madatory. Easy A or B. Drop the lowest of first 7 test.

Great professor, great class! She makes finance easy to understand. There are 7 tests but she drops the lowest grade of the first 6. I stopped going to class after the first few tests and still made A's! I would definitely recommend her to everyone!

Great beginning finance class.  She breaks up the material into many tests so you don't have to memorize all the material at once.  The book is not needed, but come to class to learn instead.  Study her slides to memorize concepts and generally understand formulas (even though they are usually included on tests).  Do the work and you'll get an A.

Easy class, textbook is not needed. Her powerpoints are self contained.  Attendance is not mandatory but very helpful.  7 exams, drops lowest grade, extra credit built in to every exam.  Sounds like a lot of exams but it helps break up the material and makes the test easier.  No homework or group projects.  I highly recommend her.

Wonderful teacher! Very helpful and willing to show you how things work. Get a scientific calculator for $20, it will make the class easier due to having so many formulas. Tests are broken down into single chapters, makes it easier to study! Take her for Finance if you can!
Great professor!  There are a lot of tests, but it helps to keep the material straight.  Gives great study guides and responds to students quickly via email.  I highly recommend this professor.
This teacher is great! Very helpful! Gives you formulas on the test!
Great teacher! an easy A with minimal out of class time. plus, most of the topics are interesting.

The BEST teacher by far!!  She's very thorough and easy to understand.  She gives great examples which really help you on the tests.  She also gives a study guide for each test.  Study that and you will do fine!!!!
The best teacher Ive had in my 3 years at KSU.  A lot of tests so material is broken down into bits you can understand. No mandatory attendance!

The BEST @ KSU so far. 2nd year at KSU. Very concise explanations. The best part about her class is she gives 7 or 8 tests throughout the course and she drops the lowest exam.  Extremely fair and makes herself available for extra help. great personality also. i will take her for any of my other finance courses if she teaches them.
